com.illcode.meterman

Interface Room

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseRoom, DarkRoom

    public interface Room

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkAttribute(int attribute)
      Returns true if attribute is set
      void clearAllAttributes()
      Clear all attributes
      void clearAttribute(int attribute)
      Clear an attribute
      void entered(Room fromRoom)
      Called when the player has entered the room.
      boolean exiting(Room toRoom)
      Called as the player is exiting the room (but is still there)
      String getDescription()
      Returns the text to be displayed when the player enters the room or clicks "Look"
      Room getExit(int direction)
      Return the room associated with a given exit direction.
      String getExitLabel(int direction)
      Return the text that should be shown on the UI button for a given direction.
      String getExitName()
      Returns a potentially shorter version of the name, to be used in Exit buttons.
      String getName()
      Returns the full name of the room
      Map<String,Object> getProperties()
      Returns a modifiable Map that can be used to store properties useful for custom processing.
      List<Entity> getRoomEntities()
      Returns a list of the entities found in this room.
      void init()
      Initialize the room to its default state.
      void setAttribute(int attribute)
      Set an attribute

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
        Initialize the room to its default state. This is not called when restoring a game.

      • checkAttribute

        boolean checkAttribute(int attribute)
        Returns true if attribute is set

      • clearAttribute

        void clearAttribute(int attribute)
        Clear an attribute

      • setAttribute

        void setAttribute(int attribute)
        Set an attribute

      • clearAllAttributes

        void clearAllAttributes()
        Clear all attributes

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the full name of the room

      • getExitName

        String getExitName()
        Returns a potentially shorter version of the name, to be used in Exit buttons. This method may return a different name depending on whether the room has been visited.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Returns the text to be displayed when the player enters the room or clicks "Look"

      • getExit

        Room getExit(int direction)
        Return the room associated with a given exit direction. This method is used in the world model to get the actual room to which an exit leads.
        Parameters:
        direction - one of the button constants in UIConstants, ex UIConstants.NW_BUTTON
        Returns:
        the room that is found when exiting this room in the given direction, or null if no exit is possible in that direction.
        See Also:
        getExitLabel(int)

      • getExitLabel

        String getExitLabel(int direction)
        Return the text that should be shown on the UI button for a given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - one of the button constants in UIConstants
        Returns:
        the text that should be shown on the respective UI button, or null if the button should be hidden
        See Also:
        getExit(int)

      • getRoomEntities

        List<Entity> getRoomEntities()
        Returns a list of the entities found in this room.

      • entered

        void entered(Room fromRoom)
        Called when the player has entered the room.
        Parameters:
        fromRoom - the room (possibly null) from which the player entered

      • exiting

        boolean exiting(Room toRoom)
        Called as the player is exiting the room (but is still there)
        Parameters:
        toRoom - the room the player is attempting to move to.
        Returns:
        true to block the player from exiting, false to allow the exit (note that the exit may fail for other reasons)

      • getProperties

        Map<String,Object> getProperties()
        Returns a modifiable Map that can be used to store properties useful for custom processing.
